website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's popular choice for the Paella pan is stylish and durable.
pros: Black steel materiel won't peel, stretch or chip
Non-stick material once food is seasoned
Handles are designed to withstand high temperatures
Can be used on all heat sources
cons: This is the most expensive item on our list

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Warped badly
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I have a Matter Bourgeat 11" fry pan that I love, but this one warped badly. I purchased it for a Christmas dinner this past year and after a quick seasoning I made paella on the stove top for the family. There's is a two quarter gap now between the sides and the middle. It was past the time of return so I've just lived with it, but for this price it should not warp.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Paella Pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan is extremely well made and sturdy. It cooks evenly too, even on the grill. If you're looking for a great paella pan, this is it. I bought it as a replacement for my old pan and couldn't be happier. After using it from stovetop to oven, and twice on the grill, I've been pleased with the evenness of the heat distribution and the durability of the pan. It cleans up nicely too.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Leathem

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pan. Wonderfully seasoned now and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pan. Wonderfully seasoned now and heavy duty. Very happy with it. Works better on the grill for even heat distribution than on indoor burner due to size.
customer_reviews.author: star slinger

customer_reviews.title: Not just paella!
customer_reviews.text: This pan works great for large portions of paella but we use it for a lot more. We sear steaks, chops, veggies, etc stovetop then pop it in the hot oven to finish cooing. We use it to fry larger dinners. Whenever we are having guests, this pan is out in full force. It is sturdy, cleans well and as long as it is oiled in between uses, it is surprisingly non-stick. We are very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: wideopenseasTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great, big pan!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pan! It’s huge; sized to cook for at least 6-8 people, nice even cooking for a perfect soccarat on the bottom of the pan of an epic paella, not hard to clean after cooking. **This pan is NOT pre-seasoned, so for delicious results, make sure you do just that. They have simple instructions on the tag to season it up, but you could also toss in other veggies/peels; it’s a process to do, but worth it. The only hassle was getting that manufacturers shipping micro thin plastic coating off of the pan; I followed the instructions on the tag for removal, but it was still a pain.
customer_reviews.author: dfreeman

customer_reviews.title: Works great on the stove top as well as BBQ!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT! We love using this pan on the stove as well as the grill. Important to note that the pan DOES turn black with normal use as this is tempering the pan and should be expected. The pan heats so evenly and we love using this pan to make meals of all types.
customer_reviews.author: MnWolf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for a Paella pan

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product
customer_reviews.text: Out of 3 pans, 2 were scratched, with damaged protective surface. Decided to keep last one, scratches on the sides not bottom of skillet. Expensive product, need better control prior shipment.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Big Green Egg
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try out a new Paella recipe, and was recommended this pan by America's Test Kitchen. The pan fits perfectly inside the Large BGE, since the grill's inside is 18". The paella couldn't have been more perfect, with even browning of the bottom of the paella rice. Easily feeds 4 people. If you saw the recipe on ATK, get this pan and follow the instructions and you won't be sorry. I plan on expanding it's use by trying some stir fry recipes. The pan provides you with a great outdoor grill.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zimmermann

customer_reviews.title: High quality Pan

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen staple
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan 2.5 years ago for paella on the grill which worked perfectly. It has since become the workhorse for my kitchen. I have an induction cook top with a 14in burner and this pan is perfect. It’s my go-to for frying and grilling inside and out. It took a few uses to get it seasoned properly but since then it’s been perfect. My adult daughters were over to help prepare a stir-fry dish for a family gathering and they both fell in love with this pan. I run it under hot water with a little scrubbing, if needed to clean, then add a tiny drop of oil and wipe dry.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis

customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Give It Some Love
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and sturdy pan. But, right off the bat, it's not ready to use. You have to give it some love. Follow the instructions to "season" the pan, and then do it again. And again. And again. Then, just cook with it. I not only use it to make Paella, but I'll use it as a "griddle" on Sunday mornings for breakfast. Hash browns on one side, Eggs on another, Bacon on another...etc. I'll sear my steaks in it after they cook in the Sous Vide. The more you use it, the more love you give it, the darker it gets, and then the better the end product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brian Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: twenty seconds later the rust wiped off like nothing was ever on it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this open box (unused), had a swath of surface rust on it but nothing a little vinegar couldn't fix...twenty seconds later the rust wiped off like nothing was ever on it. Scrubbed the the pan with a green scrubby in hot water, hand dried it and proceeded too season this beast on the grill. Great pan, heavy but says quality all over it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I cured by running through the dish washer, drying very throughly, rubbing in flax seed oil, and then putting in my oven and turning on clean the oven. It took three hours and I let set without opening door until oven and pan were cool. I took pan out and used a paper towel to rub on olive oil. The pan is perfectly black. I have used it three times. It is truly non stick and it is beautiful. Great buy. An instant favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Choate

customer_reviews.title: A must have pan for those who love to cook
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of mineral steel pans and own about 5. They season quickly and can be almost nonstick when a fat is used. I can fry an egg in mine with oil, and it will slide around the pan like it’s Teflon. You must wipe the pan clean between eggs to keep it nonstick. I prefer this brand because they do not put a clear coat on the handle. Other brands do and the coating gets soft in the oven, sticking to hot pads/towels.
customer_reviews.author: 10D43

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for more than just paella.
customer_reviews.text: This pan requires a little bit of work on the front end to season it, but it cooks really well. I made paella for 20 plus people without a problem. If you want the traditional depth of paella you could still feed at least 12 people. The heat distribution was fantastic. I used a kettle burner.

He 'seasoned' it for me (there are instructions in the box) and it works great. It is a little heavier than I expected (about 6 lbs, I think) but my husband says that makes it heat more evenly. Gotta agree!

customer_reviews.title: browns meat and creates great fond for flavor
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy for a reason. It retains heat very well, browns meat and creates great fond for flavor. It's used with gas burners and in the oven. I suggest that you season it outside on a grill or something similar to avoid smoking up your house. Plan on buying another for the camper to use in the Camp Chef

I mainly use them to cook chicken and vegetables... The longer I own these pans, the better they get... It's important to season them well and keep them seasoned...
